summary: This bill, H.R. 195, titled the "U.S. Customs and Border Protection Relocation Act," directs the Secretary of Homeland Security to relocate the headquarters of U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) to the state of Texas by January 1, 2026. The relocation must include all functions, personnel, and real assets. The new headquarters must be strategically placed to handle crises at the U.S.-Mexico border. The bill requires the Secretary to collaborate with Texas's General Land Office and outlines procedures for acquiring the necessary land, which must meet federal title approval standards.
